channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: China Detains Dozens of Members of Underground Church
item.description: The church’s pastor, Ezra Jin Mingri, turned Zion Church into one of China’s largest unofficial congregations, even as government pressure on Christia...

item.title: 16 People Killed in Blast at Tennessee Explosives Plant, Officials Confirm
item.description: Local authorities said on Saturday that they had shifted their focus to searching for remains. The cause of the explosion was unclear.

item.title: Diane Keaton’s quiet activism helped preserve these Los Angeles landmarks
item.description: "I’ll never understand why architecture is considered a second cousin to painting and film," Diane Keaton wrote in 2008.

item.title: How Diane Keaton’s ‘Annie Hall’ Look Was Integral to Her Art
item.description: Though she downplayed it, her role in creating the outfits of “Annie Hall” made her the author of a fascinating career.

item.title: Will Paul Biya of Cameroon, the World’s Oldest President, Win Again?
item.description: President Paul Biya of Cameroon would be nearly 100 years old by the time he completed his eighth term, but he has promised that “the best is still to...

item.title: At Least 1 Dead and 3 Injured After Shootings at Mississippi Universities
item.description: The shootings at historically Black institutions occurred within about 24 hours of three other shootings across rural Mississippi that left at least e...

item.title: She Studies the Russian ‘Red Man’ Whose Bloody War Evokes Soviet Tyranny
item.description: After winning the Nobel Prize for her searing portraits of the Soviet world unraveling, Svetlana Alexievich worries about the revival of its violent, ...

item.title: China Detains Dozens of Members of Underground Church
item.description: The church’s pastor, Ezra Jin Mingri, turned Zion Church into one of China’s largest unofficial congregations, even as government pressure on Christia...

item.title: China Flexed. Trump Hit Back. So Much for the Thaw.
item.description: Beijing’s trade curbs and President Trump’s tariff threats show how quickly calm can give way to confrontation between the two largest economies.

item.title: ‘Over the Clouds’: Families of Palestinian Prisoners Await Their Release
item.description: Israel agreed to free 250 Palestinians serving life sentences, many of whom will be sent into exile. For their families, it brought joy. But for those...

item.title: Will Paul Biya of Cameroon, the World’s Oldest President, Win Again?
item.description: President Paul Biya of Cameroon would be nearly 100 years old by the time he completed his eighth term, but he has promised that “the best is still to...

item.title: Silicon Valley tech boss Marc Benioff says he’s all for Trump sending troops to San Francisco since ‘we don’t have enough cops’
item.description: “We don’t have enough cops, so if they can be cops, I’m all for it,” Benioff told The New York Times on Friday.

item.title: Pentagon to use R&D money to pay troops during government shutdown
item.description: A spokesperson for the White House Office of Management and Budget said Pentagon research and development funds would be used to pay the salaries.

item.title: Diane Keaton, Oscar-winning star of ‘Annie Hall’ and ‘The Godfather,’ dies at 79
item.description: People Magazine reported Saturday that she died in California with loved ones, citing a family spokesperson.

item.title: At this rate, the price of gold could soar to $10,000 per ounce in just three years
item.description: "If it continues on its current path, it could reach $10,000 before the end of the decade."
